definition: bamboo frame for drying clothes/bamboo cage
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to tell fox ghost stories around a bonfire and incite rebellion/an uprising is afoot (idiom)

sentences.english: We set up a tent and made a bonfire.
sentences.chinese: 我们支上帐篷，生起篝火。

sentences.english: As soon as this was done, they cooked a meal oven an open fire.
sentences.chinese: 这件事刚做完，他们就在篝火上烧起了饭。

sentences.english: Soldiers used smoke in the day time and fire at night to deliver the message.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们在白天用烽烟，夜间用篝火传递消息。

sentences.english: Occasionally a bonfire would be set under an old willow.
sentences.chinese: 有时候站在古柳下面点起篝火。

sentences.english: I dredged his fish in cornmeal and fried it over the fire.
sentences.chinese: 我在鱼上撒了玉米粉，放在篝火上烤。

sentences.english: She began a slow saunter toward the bonfires.
sentences.chinese: 她开始向篝火处慢慢走去。

sentences.english: As a bonfire dispels chilliness, so our solidarity drives away the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 篝火驱散寒冷，我们的团结可以驱散敌人。

sentences.english: Aunt Kat vividly described the huge bonfires and colorful rituals she had witnessed at the Beltane festival in Edinburgh as a girl.
sentences.chinese: 凯特阿姨生动地形容高高的篝火和有趣的典礼。

sentences.english: They see things in the soft haze of a spring day, or in the red fire on a long winter's evening.
sentences.chinese: 他们在春天的薄雾或冬夜的篝火里辨清事物。

sentences.english: Students were all in high spirits and many students went in front of the fire to sing songs or dance.
sentences.chinese: 同学们个个热情高涨，很多同学来到篝火前载歌载舞。

sentences.english: And the flickering reflections flung by the camp-fire .
sentences.chinese: 露营地的一切都被大雨淋透了，那堆篝火也给浇灭了。

sentences.english: Sparkly copper, shimmery and flashy like a bonfire in May.
sentences.chinese: 闪闪发光的铜色，像五月的篝火般闪耀。

sentences.english: Sample some barbecue and enjoy live blues music during the two day event.
sentences.chinese: 在这两天里面参加一些篝火晚会和享受一下蓝调音乐。

sentences.english: They say they can't afford it and have made an artificial bonfire instead.
sentences.chinese: 他们出不起这笔钱，因此做了个假的篝火来代替。

sentences.english: In my old home we used to sit outside all night with the fire.
sentences.chinese: 我们在自己老家的时候，可以围着篝火一夜坐到天亮。

sentences.english: They made a straw man and put him on top of it.
sentences.chinese: 他们做了草人，放在了篝火上方。

definition: to sit in a circle/seated around (a narrator)
